text: In Germanic paganism, Baduhenna is a goddess of war. She is only referred to by Tacitus in the "Annals," where he tells of a grove in Frisia that was dedicated to her, near where 900 Roman prisoners were killed in 28 CE.Simek (2007:26). == Notes == == References == * Simek, Rudolf (2007) translated by Angela Hall. Dictionary of Northern Mythology. D.S. Brewer. Category:Germanic mythology
title: Baduhenna
